author: wsjcom
title: Why Cities Boom While Towns Struggle
text:
The jobs gap is also a jobs map: Places that succeed have a critical mass of creativity, writes William A. Galston in The Wall Street Journal, while discussing Berkeley economist Enrico Moretti’s “The New Geography of Jobs.” “The transition from mass production to the knowledge economy has transformed the geography of opportunity,” Mr. Galston says. “Not only do skilled workers earn between two and three times as much in innovation centers as they do in less successful areas, but also their earnings have a powerful multiplier effect on the jobs and wages of less-skilled workers in their communities.”
